description: Triangle of increasing mobiles (circular rooted trees) with n nodes and k leaves.
comments: In an increasing rooted tree, nodes are numbered and numbers increase as you move away from root.This is also related to the solution of the equation df/dt=f e^f (see the Maple code). - _F. Chapoton_, Jul 16 2004
links: Shi-Mei Ma, Some combinatorial sequences associated with context-free grammars, arXiv:1208.3104v2 [math.CO]. - From N. J. A. Sloane, Aug 21 2012
Index entries for sequences related to mobiles
maple: P[1]:=1;for n from 1 to 8 do P[n+1]:=simplify((1+n*x)*P[n]+x*diff(P[n],x)) end; (Chapoton)
crossrefs: Row sums give A029768. Columns 2 through 8: A000295, A055357-A055362.
author: _Christian G. Bower_, May 15 2000
